Transcript:
Coop: For most, it was just an ordinary summer night. Fireflies dancing, the 
air thick with heat. But for Ava and me, tonight would be anything but ordinary. 
Call it love, call it lust, call it about damn time, but we had big plans. Then 
again, I wasn't the only Cooper with big plans.
Frank: All right.
Marina: Come here.
Frank: Ah! Ah! Ah! Is that... is that necessary?
Harley and Marina: Yes.

Coop: My brother, Frank, is a decorated officer, the chief of police, in 
fact, but in our family, he's still Frank, the resident good guy in need of a 
good girl.
Frank: Oh, my gosh.
Harley: So you have absolutely no idea what this girl looks like?
Frank: No, sis, it's a blind date.

Marina: But you talked to her on the phone, right? I mean, what does it sound 
like she looks like?
Frank: What?
Harley: Her voice! Is she like Kathleen Turner or one of the Olsen twins?
Frank: I don't know.
Harley: Whatever. Just don't, don't discuss politics.
Marina: And weather. Do not talk about the weather.
Harley: Or religion...
Marina: Or sports...

Frank: Sports? Oh, now you're drawing the line. Come on! Now look, I'm 
teasing you. But, you know what? You guys are treating me like I've never been 
out with a lady before. Come on.
Marina: And do not call her a lady. It sounds old.
Frank: Okay, fine. Then what do I talk about?
Marina: Her.
Harley: Her. Let her know how intriguing and fascinating you find her.

Marina: Yes, and then she'll be like, "Oh, wow, this is totally one 
thoughtful and caring guy." And then that's when she'll ask more about you.
Harley: Mhmm. And don't screw that up.
Frank: What does that mean?
Harley: Don't talk shop.
Marina: You better take his badge away. He's a flasher.
Frank: Oh, no.
Harley: Give me.
Frank: No, no, no. Absolutely not. No, no, it's my badge.
Harley: Just give it to me.
Frank: No, no, you don't-- oh!
Harley: Thanks. Okay, come on. Come on.

Frank: Come on you guys. Okay, you know what this means? This means I'm going 
to have to put on my special moves for her.
Harley: What a threat.
Marina: Oh, give her it.

Harley: No, no, no. Oh, come on. You're going to be late, you're going to be 
late. You have to go.
Marina: So, where are you taking her?
Frank: What? Come on, pizza and a movie.

Marina: Oh! Dad! How are you supposed to get to know her? You can't talk 
during a movie.
Harley: And I've seen you eat pizza.
Frank: Okay. You have a better idea?
Harley: You think?
Marina: He needs it.
Harley: Okay, come on. Quick, quick. Take off your shirt.
Frank: What now?
Harley: Just take off your shirt.
Frank: My shirt? What are you going to do now?
Coop: Frank had no idea what he was getting into.
Harley: All right. You ready?
Frank: What are you two... ?
Coop: And, as it turned out, neither did our father.
Buzz: Why? Why do I have to wear this?
Olivia: Because you look good in it. You do, and I have the finishing touch.
Buzz: Oh, no. No, no, no. No hats.
Olivia: It's a toque blanche.
Buzz: It's a French name... that's a stupid white hat.
Olivia: It goes to a good cause.
Buzz: Aw, come on.

Olivia: Proceeds go to the restoration of the Beacon. Look, it's a local 
landmark, it's my bread and butter and half the town lives there, so there you 
go...

Buzz: Okay. Look, I'm doing it for you. But good luck with the competition. 
They're not going to wear any stupid hats.
Olivia: Well...
Buzz: They're local chefs, there not gonna touch this.
Olivia: It’s not exactly a local chef, but…
Petrovsky: Buzz Cooper?
Buzz: Yeah I’m Buzz Cooper, you are… are…

Petrovsky: Yes, I am. Here, in the flesh, in your very small town. May the 
best chef win, eh?

Buzz: I'm competing against a celebrity. He's a celebrity chef! He's a 
seven-foot-tall celebrity chef. With a big knife.
Harley: Hello? A little help, please.
Marina: Yeah, I think he's going to be okay as long as he just pays atten...
Harley: Marina!
Marina: What?
Harley: Could you help out a sister here and...
Marina: What?
Harley: Get me a tampon.

Marina: Oh. I was wondering what was taking you so long. You use the x-large 
jumbo kind, right?
Harley: Shut up! Thank you.
Marina: Uh-huh. You know, what would this family do without me?
Harley: I hope we never have to find that out.

Marina: Handling those Cooper men is like a full-time, two- woman job. They 
can hardly tie their own shoes.
Harley: You're not just figuring that out, are you?

Marina: Well, what did you do in these moments of womanly crisis before I was 
around?

Harley: You should feel sorry for your father. You have absolutely no idea 
what it was like for him raising a little girl.

Maria: Yeah, well, you know, at least now he has you and, well, both of us to 
watch his back.
Harley: Hmm. Well, pretty quiet in here. Not much going on tonight.

Ashlee: Coming through! Hi, yeah, just give me one second, I'm alone here. 
And for the last time, there's no spinach pie-- tonight, or ever. Thank you. Hi, 
yeah, this way.

Coop: At least my night was going according to plan. Ava and I, in a rare 
stroke of luck, had managed to get the same night off. Ashlee was new to the 
job, but eager to prove herself. And Wednesdays were always slow, anyway.
Ava: Hey, there. What?
Coop: What do you mean, "What"? Look at you, you look beautiful.
Ava: Thank you. I can't believe tonight is finally happening.

Coop: I know, I know. And guess what? I've already made reservations at that 
restaurant on the lake.
Ava: Oh, good. I wanted to try that place. And then what?
Coop: And then what? Are you kidding me? We're already checked in.

Ava: Oh, great. Thanks. It's kind of busy tonight, right? It's a little 
weird.
Coop: Yeah, weird. So, you ready? ( Loud crash )
Ashlee: I'll nuke them in a minute, lady. I'm all alone here.

Coop: We were this close. I had hoped for a memorable night. Maybe I should 
have been more specific.
Ashlee: Coop.
Coop: Yeah? What do we got, Ashlee?
Ashlee: The register is jammed.

Coop: Yeah, don't worry about it, it does it all the time. There you go. 
Voila. Don't worry about it, you'll get the hang of this, okay?
Ashlee: Okay.
Coop: Well, there goes our wonderful evening.
Ava: Well, the night's not over yet.

Coop: You know what, you're taking this a lot better than I am, I'll tell you 
that.
Ava: My new dress has put me in a really good mood.

Coop: Yeah, well, your new dress has put me in a good mood, too, I'll tell 
you that. Come here.
Ashlee: Okay, coming through. Sorry. Sorry, sorry. Oh, God!
Ava: Wait, wait, wait.
Ashlee: No, it's okay. It's like I have vertigo or something.
Ava: It's nerves. It's just nerves.

Ashlee: I swear when things slow down, you guys can go on your date, and, you 
know, I really have things under control.
Ava: It's fine.
Coop: It's okay, I understand.

Ashlee: Oh, my God! Oh, my God! I am so sorry. I am so sorry. Here, I have 
water. I'm sorry, it's just, it's just who orders guacamole with French fries?
Ava: You know what? Guacamole's actually really good for the hair.
Ashlee: Oh, God, I'm sorry. I thought that was mayonnaise?

Ava: No, it's, you know, guacamole's great for the hair. You should see what 
they're charging at the salons. Oh, boy. Okay. All right.

Coop: I thought Ava made a great save. Unfortunately, the customer did not. 
Still, a little guacamole wouldn't keep us from our romantic night. But 
something else was about to. At least Frank was having better luck in the 
romance department, and that's not something we get to say often around here.
Frank: You probably think I'm nuts bringing you up here, huh?
Teresa: I think it's great. I was expecting the standard first date movie.
Frank: ( Laughs ) Well, you know, you really can't talk in a movie.
Teresa: Exactly! You're like the first guy I've ever met that gets that.

Frank: Well, then, you know what, Teresa? I honestly believe that you've been 
hanging out with the wrong kind of guys.
Teresa: It sounds like it. So, what made you pick the roof?
Frank: Let's just say the idea kind of came to me.

Coop: Actually, all of Frank's ideas were just coming to him... from 
somewhere else.
Harley: I told him to go with the wine.
Marina: How do you know he didn't?
Harley: That was the clink of champagne flutes. Wine glasses sound different.
Marina: You are good.

Harley: Mm. Been doing this a long time. Frank? Champagne is overkill. I bet 
you bought two bottles, too. Over the top!
Frank: What do you mean over the top?
Teresa: What?
Frank: Uh, the view. The view from here is over top of the town.
Harley: Nice save. And makes sure she sees the west view.
Frank: Have you seen the restroom?
Teresa: Oh, I don't have to go.
Frank: Oh.
Marina: Dad! The west view. ( Laughs )

Frank: Oh, well that's good because I wanted to show you the view from the 
west side. Look at that summer moon.
Teresa: It's beautiful.
Harley: And now you say something back.

Frank: You know, I love coming up here because it helps me take my mind off 
the little annoying distractions down there.
Marina: So ungrateful.
Harley: Totally!

Teresa: Annoying distractions? You wouldn't happen to be talking about the 
"Springfield Burns" web site, would you?
Harley: Whoa, where did that come from?
Frank: You know what? I'm really not into gossip.

Teresa: Oh, no, no, neither am I, I mean, but I'm just a little curious. I 
mean, I think I read something about the chief of police and his father 
competing for the same woman.
Harley: Deny it.
Marina: No, don't lie.

Teresa: Look, Frank, I just want to make sure you're not already taken. What 
was her name? Olivia?
Marina: Quick, change the subject.
Harley: Politics!
Marina: Sports!
Harley: Weather!
Frank: What?

Coop: If my night had hit a speed bump, my brother's had hit an iceberg. But, 
at least there was hope for dad.

TV host: All right, folks, settle in. Listen, about 30 seconds from now we're 
going to be on the air. We need lots of enthusiasm, lots of energy. Be loud, all 
right? Let's try it. Here we go. (Cheers and applause )

Olivia: Keep your eye on the prize. You keep your eye on the prize, okay? I 
have faith in you.
Buzz: I'm going to throw up.
Olivia: Oh.

TV host: Hey, everybody! I'm Hal Candig and it is time to play "Food Fight"! 
It's going to be a great day. Here's the scoop: We have two chefs, 30 minutes, 
same ingredients. Who is going to come out on top with the great dish? Oh, boy, 
we've got some competition. We have Michel Petrovsky - he is the Apollo Creed, 
the undisputed champion! You bet, it should be just terrific. And right here, 
Buzz Cooper's along with us. How about a hand for Buzz Cooper? (Crowd cheers )

TV host: Buzz, I guess we can say, is the rocky of the range, so we're almost 
set to get started. Here we go! ( Crowd cheers )
Buzz: He is a member of the French Culinary Institute.
Olivia: So what?

Buzz: You know, he's had his own TV shows? Do you know how many restaurants 
he's opened?
Olivia: You're a franchise, too.
Buzz: The man has won an Emmy.
Olivia: Oh, well done.

Buzz: You could have told me a little sooner that I was competing against the 
heavyweight champion of the world.
Olivia: Didn't Apollo Creed die at the end of "Rocky III?"
Buzz: Yeah, but Rocky didn't kill him.
Olivia: Well...
Buzz: And it was number four.

Olivia: Okay, then this is your "Rocky IV." Petrovsky's going down! Look, I 
believe in you. Plus, you're the local favorite. This whole town is in your 
corner. Right? ( Cheers )
Olivia: I think you're incredible and not just in the kitchen.
Petrovsky: Hey, is not fair. Where is good luck kiss for me, eh? ( Laughs )

TV host: All right, let's meet our chefs right now and see what they're 
making today. Howdy, folks. We wish you the best of luck and listen, don't 
forget today's competition is a benefit for the Beacon Hotel restoration. So, 
folks, how about we put down our weapons, if you will, shake hands? Are we ready 
to cook? Let's have a food fight! Take it away! ( Crowd cheers ) (frantic music 
)

Coop: What will a man do for love? Or, should I say, what won't he do. My 
father was willing to go 15 rounds with the king of the kitchen. My brother was 
willing to wear a wire to woo a woman. And me? I was willing to face every 
Cooper's worst nightmare. Even on a hot summer night. He wore his signature 
black trench coat. A man whose very presence struck fear into the heart of every 
restauranteur across the county.
Inspector: Rob cook, Health Inspector. Who's in charge?
Coop: I am. Henry Cooper Bradshaw.
Ava: Weren't you supposed to be coming in tomorrow, sir?
Inspector: Surprise.

Ashlee: I'm sorry, sir. It's all my fault. You see, I have vertigo and I 
spilled these drinks, and I spilled guaca...
Coop: Ashlee, it's okay. Just let us know if there's anything you need, Rob.
Inspector: Call me Mr. Cook.
Ava: Okay, this is really bad considering the rush we just had and...

Coop: Look, Ava. Ava, it's okay. All right? This nice guy is trying to do his 
job, so I think we owe it to him and to the health department to let them do 
their job and make it easier.
Ava: Okay. What's wrong with you?

Coop: Ladies and gentlemen, can I please have your attention? I regret to 
inform you that Company will be closing to accommodate a pop quiz from the 
health department. Those are the nice folks that have made Company the excellent 
track-record-running restaurant that it is. So, I apologize for the 
inconvenience and we'll be taking care of you guys.
Customer: What about our dinners?
Coop: They're on the house. We'll pack them on up for you guys. Come on up.

Coop: It was hard enough for Ava and I to make our escape. Frank didn't have 
the luxury of making a run for it. He was beginning to wish he hadn't taken 
Teresa to the top of such a tall building.
Teresa: So, this Olivia. Who was she with first? You or your father?

Frank: You know what? I really don't like talking about ex-girlfriends, I 
have to admit.

Teresa: I know, but, Frank, the whole town is talking about it. I mean, 
thanks to Sprinfieldburns.com. I mean, come on, it must make you crazy.
Harley: This woman's a piece of work.

Frank: You know what? Enough about me. Please, tell me something about 
yourself.
Marina: Good save, Dad.

Frank: You know what? I really went into this blind date totally blind. And 
forgive me, because you know what? I don't even know what you do for a living.
Teresa: I'm in publishing.

Frank: Publishing? Wow, that's pretty nifty. What kind of book do you like to 
read?
Maria: Did he just say "nifty?"
Harley: Focus on the positive?
Teresa: I work more in the magazine side of things.
Frank: Well, one I might know?

Teresa: "Springfield Mirror?" Look, I'd love to scoop whoever's behind the 
"Springfield Burns" story.
Frank: Whoa, whoa, hold on one second here. You're a reporter?
Marina: Oh, my God. Oh, my God!
Harley: Abort! Abort!
Frank: So I'm not really exactly on a date here. I'm just a source for you?

Teresa: Look, I was desperate for the interview, but you know the crazy thing 
is, Frank... I really like you. I really do.
Harley: That's the crazy part?
Marina: Throw her off the roof.
Harley: Marina!
Marina: What? ( Harley laughs )
Frank: Um... you know what? I like you, too, but you set me up.

Teresa: Look, I know. I feel terrible. Look, here. Here. Take this. I wish it 
were as easy to rewind as this date.
Frank: ( Laughs )
Harley: Wait, what is that?
Marina: I'm not the expert, but I think he's laughing.
Frank: Hey, look. See this?
Harley: I'm not getting anything. Frank, are you there?
Frank: And... this right here?
Harley: Whistle, or something.
Marina: Testing.

Frank: I... you know, don't ask. It's kind of a long story. I've got a wire 
on here, and... I'll tell you what. Why don't we start this all over again and 
we'll call it even, okay? ( Laughter )
Harley: I think we lost him.
Crowd: Cooper, Cooper, Cooper!
Olivia: We love you guys! ( Crowd continues shouting, "Cooper!" )

Coop: Harley and Marina hadn't lost Frank. He'd lost them. He was the second 
Cooper tonight to get a second chance. That left dad.

TV host: Oh! You know what that means. Put your knives down, everybody, and 
it's time to come on over and see what the chefs have prepared.
Coop: Ava, are you sure you're okay with skipping dinner tonight?
Ava: Yeah, I think it's fine, I just need...
TV host: Chef Petrovsky, what do we have here? It looks phenomenal.
Ava: Oh, my God. Do you know who that is?
Frank: Listen, if you want a real success story...
Teresa: Oh, I know all about Michel Petrovsky.

Petrovsky: ... Something in honor of great heartland. It is spice-crusted New 
York strip steak with special house sauce, with twice-baked potato with 
horseradish, green onions, and creme fraiche. ( Applause )

TV host: It looks spectacular. Now, let's go over here right now and meet 
with Buzz Cooper. Buzz... what are you... what are you wearing and serving?

Buzz: Well, it's sort of my variation on shepherd's pie. It’s... there's no 
point in judging this. You're... you're out of my league, so... congratulations.

Ava: How could you do this to Buzz? A cook-off with Michel Petrovsky? I mean, 
what's next, golfing with Tiger Woods?
Buzz: Hey, look, it's not her fault.
Frank: Excuse me. It never is, is it?

Olivia: What, what, what? You're coming in here with through your press corps 
now, Frank? Who is she, the Springfield blogger?
Buzz: Honey, you don't have to defend me.
Coop: Oh, Dad, stop defending her.
Olivia: She has a tape recorder!
Buzz: You're taping this?

TV host: Excuse me. Excuse me. We're taping this. The show is still on the 
air.
Buzz: This is what my family's come to? You're taping this?
Frank: Excuse me, I came here to check up on you, okay?
Buzz: Oh, don't do me any favors, Frank.
Frank: Okay, I won’t. ( Arguing over each other )

Coop: We'll never know who started it. It snuck up on us like a sudden spell 
of rain that comes out of nowhere to wash away a summer night. A flash of 
lightning, a clap of thunder, the skies open up, and before you know it...
( shouting and arguing )

Coop: The perfect storm.  Here's the thing about a perfect storm-- like my 
dad's shepherd's pie, it takes a special mix of ingredients, a certain set of 
circumstances that are unlikely to repeat themselves.
Buzz: I'm sorry, I shouldn’t have ducked.

Olivia: No, don't you dare blame yourself. You know that I make you happy. 
They're the ones with the problem.
Coop: Happy? Happy? You call this happy?

TV host: All right, now would be a good time for us to move on to the 
judging.

Buzz: Great! Because my family loves to judge! And I have tried to be 
understanding about this, Frank! I agonized-- I agonized!-- Over dating her 
after you two broke up. Ava, I tried to understand the outrageous idea that she 
left you to die in a fire! And Coop, I tried to respect you standing up for her, 
but I am never, never going to apologize for loving the woman that I love! ( 
Applause )
Buzz: Thank you.
Frank: Don't encourage her.
Coop: Let's go on.

Buzz: I am not sorry I chose her! I am not sorry for who I am! And I am not 
sorry for my cooking!
TV host: All right, you may want to rethink the cooking part.
Buzz: Excuse me, exactly what is that supposed to mean?

TV host: I'm just saying that we had you on television to try and create a 
great reality program and what we got was the culinary equivalent of canned 
soup.
Buzz: Excuse me, I happen to like canned soup, okay?

Ava: Yeah. You know what? Buzz happens to do some beautiful things with soup, 
okay? So, forget the cuisine. He knows real cooking.
TV host: Fine. Fine, all right? Do you know real cooking?
Olivia: Hey, don't judge a cook by his lover. Hey, give me this thing!
( Screaming, arguing, and shouting )

Coop: Some storms can't be predicted, but I could have called this one. It's 
one thing when the Coopers go head to head with each other. But when an outsider 
goes after one of us, watch out.
(Whistle blows )
Harley: Springfield PD!
Marina: Drop your weapons. Put your hands in the air. Dad?

Frank: Hi, honey. This is Teresa. This is my daughter, Marina, and my sister, 
Harley.
Marina: Yeah, you're lucky we're on duty, reporter girl.
Harley: Guys, what is this?
TV host: Arrest these people. They've turned "Food Fight" into a...
Coop: Food fight?
Harley: Who are you?
Marina: Yeah, and why are you so tall?
Buzz: Because he's Michel Petrovsky.
Petrovsky: Hmm... delicious. We'll exchange recipes before I go.
Buzz: We will?

Harley: No, no, no, no. There's not going to be any recipe exchanging. This 
is what we're going to do.
Frank: You can't do this. I'm the Chief of Police!
Harley: Really? You got a badge?
Frank: What are you talking about? You've got my badge!
Harley: What are you talking about it?
Marina: I have no idea.
Frank: Marina, you're grounded.
Marina: Good luck with that one, big guy.
Harley: Ladies, your cell is that way.
Buzz: You're locking them up?
Olivia: Buzz, it's okay, even though Ava started it.
Coop: You're lying.
Ava: Oh, shocker.
Buzz: Hang in their, honey.
Coop: Ava, I'll try and get you out of this, okay?
Frank: Teresa! Teresa! It'll be okay.

Coop: It was a good night gone bad, a night that started out with promise and 
ended up in a jail cell.
Buzz: Not bad.

Coop: Leave it to my father to find the silver lining. "Twelve Angry Men" is 
one of my favorite plays. There are only three of us, but trust me, there was 
enough anger to go around.
Frank: I'll have their badges for this.
Coop: What?
Frank: I said I'll have their badges for this, Harley and Marina.
Buzz: Oh, I think they got you beat to that, Chief.
( Coop laughs )
Coop: Frank, what? It was funny.
Buzz: How did they get your badge away from you, Frank?
Frank: They were prepping me for a blind date.
Coop: How'd that go?

Frank: Well, gee, Coop, how do you think it went? My date's in a cell just 
down the hallway. (Buzz laughs )
Frank: Oh, God, not you, too. Oh, great, that's all I need. Oh, my God.
Buzz: Where are you going to take her on a second date, Frank?

Frank: I don't know, Pop, maybe I'll get some strings and get a nice little 
table at Alcatraz. Funny thing is, is if I could just get the tape recorder away 
from her, I actually like the lady.

Coop: No. No, Frank, you do not call her a lady, all right? That's way too 
old.
Frank: What is with you and Marina?
Coop: I just can't believe that you considered tonight a good date.
Frank: It was better than yours.

Coop: Well, let's think about that. Ava covered in whipped cream? Frank, I'm 
not really complaining there. I mean, when it comes to me, I'm thinking the only 
person who really got screwed here is dad.

Buzz: What? I had a great night. Michel Petrovsky liked my shepherd's pie and 
made money for the Beacon. Guys, come on. Cut Olivia a break.
Coop: Sorry.
Frank: Just don't want to see you get hurt, Pop.

Buzz: Well, where have I heard that before? Oh, yeah, I remember. I've been 
saying it for years to you and you and my daughter and my granddaughter. What 
was your reply?
Coop: Butt out.
Buzz: Thank you! Can we move on to something else?

Frank: You know, is it really wrong to talk about sports, religion, or 
politics and all that, you know, on a first date?
Coop: Who told you that?
Buzz: Bet I know.
Frank: I'm definitely going to have their badges.

Coop: It was the first real conversation we'd had in weeks.”We didn't agree 
on anything. Nothing, in fact. But it was real. It was fun, it was... “
Ava: What did that crazy lady police officer say? Oh, my God, what a night!

Teresa: I believe her exact words were, "Two minutes and I'm coming in to get 
you."
Ava: Oh, yikes.

Teresa: What's up with what's-her-name? She said she'd rather sit in a jail 
cell than be one of those women who goes to the bathroom in groups.
Ava: Olivia? Special.

Teresa: Yeah, well, she must be if both Frank and his dad were so crazy about 
her. What? Why are you looking at me like that?
Ava: I might look naive, okay? But I wasn't born yesterday.
Teresa: Excuse me?!

Ava: You're a reporter trying to pump me for inside information about people 
who are like family to me, right? Well, it ain't going to happen.
Teresa: I'm not looking for a story, Ava.
Ava: Yeah, right.
Teresa: I'm not. Look, I'm unarmed-- no notebook, no tape recorder.
Ava: Ah, just a razor-sharp reporter's memory?
Teresa: Okay. Okay, you want the truth?
Ava: Yeah, works for me.

Teresa: All right, I'm going to give you a little inside scoop. I... I really 
like Frank. I know I went out with him for one reason, but now...

Ava: That's too bad. What, he figured out that you were scamming him and you 
blew your chance?

Teresa: Well, I hope not. There aren't that many Frank Cooper’s in the world 
and I think I might get him to go out with me again. I just need to know if he's 
still hung up on Olivia.

Ava: You know, I just don't want to see him get hurt again. ( Knock on the 
door ) Oh, okay. All right, well, it's time for us to go here. Listen, Teresa, 
if Frank gives you another chance, which I don't know if he will, just don't 
screw it up, okay? Or else you're going to have to deal with me and the rest of 
the Cooper family. And now that you've seen them in action and you get a little 
bit of this energy, you don't want to get involved in that. I mean, the guys are 
one thing, but Marina and Harley, they're completely trouble.
Harley: That's delicious.
Marina: I'm not ashamed. I'm asking for seconds.
Harley: Mmm.

Petrovsky: You make me very happy. I love beautiful women with appetites. I'm 
just sorry tonight ended how it did.
Marina: Why? This is delicious.

Coop: And so the Cooper’s were back on track. This is the part where you'd 
expect a happily ever after, or a fade to black. But not just yet. The night was 
far from over. I don't know how the rest of the night went for Frank or my dad. 
To be honest, I wasn't thinking about them anymore. All I could think about was 
Ava. It may sound crazy to say the stars had aligned for us, but I really think 
they had. By now, Ava and I didn't need a cosmic sign, but everything around us 
pointed to romance.
Ava: Hey, is that a bottle of champagne?
Coop: Yeah, there's two of them.
Ava: Really? Two of them? How did we get so lucky. Who left it up here?

Coop: I don't know. One of them's not even open yet, but you know what? Who 
cares?

Coop: In spite of everything we'd been through tonight, or maybe because of 
it, I felt like we were the only two people in the world. Up there, among the 
stars, maybe we were. Finally, we had our night. And no more words were needed.
